info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 19 at 6:54PM MST until September 19 at 9:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff AZ
info.description:
* WHAT...Thunderstorms producing heavy rain have moved out of the area, but water is still flowing through Cataract Creek. The Flood Advisory has been extended until 9 PM MST.
* WHERE...A portion of north central Arizona, including the following county, Coconino.
* WHEN...Until 900 PM MST.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 647 PM MST, automated rain gauges indicated elevated water levels along Cataract Creek. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Pasture Wash, Little Coyote Canyon, Forster Canyon and Havasu Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Little Navajo Falls, Mooney Falls, Beaver Falls, and Supai. - This includes the following swimming holes... All swimming holes on Havasu Creek near Supai. - Additional information is available at weather.gov/flagstaff.
info.instruction: Low water crossings and area trails will become dangerous in heavy rain.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY FOR THE HAVASU CREEK BASIN NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MST THIS EVENING
